instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Imac graphic compatibility
threads.message: All graphic card 2009-2011 21` and 27` are interchangable?

threads.title: Imac graphic compatibility
threads.message:
Belive all but the 2GB 6970M in the late 2009 27" Core 2 duo. (the 1GB card works)

Also id shy away from using The bigger cards like the 4850 and 6970 in 21.5" machines, i dont believe they will work (due to heat and power consumption, i dont think any 21.5: imac will take MXM 3.0 type B, only MXM 3.0 Type A)
Please correct me if im wrong.

threads.title: Imac graphic compatibility
threads.message: All 27" cards will work in any model. But they are all shit and will die, fix the original!

threads.title: Imac graphic compatibility
threads.message: Well, what I need is to buy IMAC to test customers graphic card. Some customer send me only cards and I replace GPU, but I cannot test them. So, I want to buy a imac 21.5 from 2009. So can I test card from Imac 27 in my 21.5 2009? Or it is better to buy another model?

threads.title: Imac graphic compatibility
threads.message: No you buy a 2010 27". You can insert cards in those without taking the board out if you remove the bracket. 2009 21.5 cards are the only ones that will ONLY work in a 2009 21.5. The rest is all interchangeable.
